item.title: Mitigating AI Threats: Bridging the Gap Between AI and Legacy Security
item.dc:creator: Stu Sjouwerman
item.description:
Adopting a layered defense strategy that includes human-centric tools and updating security components.

The post Mitigating AI Threats: Bridging the Gap Between AI and Legacy Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: OpenAI to Help DoD With Cyber Defense Under New $200 Million Contract
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
OpenAI has been awarded a $200 million contract for AI capabilities to help the Defense Department address national security challenges.

The post OpenAI to Help DoD With Cyber Defense Under New $200 Million Contract appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Chrome 137 Update Patches High-Severity Vulnerabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Google has released a Chrome 137 update to resolve two memory bugs in the browser’s V8 and Profiler components.

The post Chrome 137 Update Patches High-Severity Vulnerabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Code Execution Vulnerabilities Patched in Veeam, BeyondTrust Products
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Veeam and BeyondTrust have resolved several vulnerabilities that could be exploited for remote code execution.

The post Code Execution Vulnerabilities Patched in Veeam, BeyondTrust Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Data Breach at Healthcare Services Firm Episource Impacts 5.4 Million People
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Hackers have stolen personal and health information belonging to the customers of healthcare organizations served by Episource.

The post Data Breach at Healthcare Services Firm Episource Impacts 5.4 Million People appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New ClickFix Malware Variant ‘LightPerlGirl’ Targets Users in Stealthy Hack
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Researchers identify a previously unknown ClickFix variant exploiting PowerShell and clipboard hijacking to deliver the Lumma infostealer via a compromised travel site.

The post New ClickFix Malware Variant ‘LightPerlGirl’ Targets Users in Stealthy Hack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Zyxel Firewall Vulnerability Again in Attacker Crosshairs
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
GreyNoise warns of a spike in exploitation attempts targeting a two-year-old vulnerability in Zyxel firewalls.

The post Zyxel Firewall Vulnerability Again in Attacker Crosshairs appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: US Insurance Industry Warned of Scattered Spider Attacks
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Google is warning insurance companies that Scattered Spider appears to have shifted its focus from the retail sector. 

The post US Insurance Industry Warned of Scattered Spider Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Circumvent Raises $6 Million for Cloud Security Platform
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Cloud security startup Circumvent has raised $6 million to develop a network of agents for autonomous prioritization and remediation.

The post Circumvent Raises $6 Million for Cloud Security Platform appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Organizations Warned of Vulnerability Exploited Against Discontinued TP-Link Routers
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
CISA warns that a vulnerability impacting multiple discontinued TP-Link router models is exploited in the wild.

The post Organizations Warned of Vulnerability Exploited Against Discontinued TP-Link Routers appeared first on SecurityWeek.
